<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#after-you-create-a-virtual-machine-you-need-to-modify-the-network-security-group-nsg-to-allow-connections-to-tcp-port-8080-on-the-virtual-machine" id="user-content-after-you-create-a-virtual-machine-you-need-to-modify-the-network-security-group-nsg-to-allow-connections-to-tcp-port-8080-on-the-virtual-machine"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>After you create a virtual machine, you need to modify the [Network Security Group (NSG)] to allow connections to TCP port 8080 on the virtual machine.</h3>

The forest contains 5,000 user accounts. Your company plans to migrate all network resources to Azure and to decommission the on-premises data center. You need to recommend a solution to minimize the impact on users after the planned migration. What should you recommend?</h3>
<ul class="contains-task-list">
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Implement Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input checked="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Sync all the Active Directory user accounts to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Instruct all users to change their password.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Create a guest user account in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) for each user.</li>
</ul>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#you-are-tasked-with-deploying-a-critical-lob-application-which-will-be-installed-on-a-virtual-machine-to-azure-you-are-informed-that-the-application-deployment-strategy-should-allow-for-a-guaranteed-availability-of-9999-percent-you-need-to-make-sure-that-the-strategy-requires-as-little-virtual-machines-and-availability-zones-as-possible-solution-you-include-two-virtual-machines-and-two-availability-zones-in-your-strategy-does-the-solution-meet-the-goal" id="user-content-you-are-tasked-with-deploying-a-critical-lob-application-which-will-be-installed-on-a-virtual-machine-to-azure-you-are-informed-that-the-application-deployment-strategy-should-allow-for-a-guaranteed-availability-of-9999-percent-you-need-to-make-sure-that-the-strategy-requires-as-little-virtual-machines-and-availability-zones-as-possible-solution-you-include-two-virtual-machines-and-two-availability-zones-in-your-strategy-does-the-solution-meet-the-goal"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>You are tasked with deploying a critical LOB application, which will be installed on a virtual machine, to Azure. <h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#you-have-been-informed-by-your-superiors-of-the-company-has-intentions-to-automate-server-deployment-to-azure-there-is-however-some-concern-that-administrative-credentials-could-be-uncovered-during-this-process-you-are-required-to-make-sure-that-during-the-deployment-the-administrative-credentials-are-encrypted-using-a-suitable-azure-solution-solution-you-recommend-the-use-of-azure-multi-factor-authentication-mfa-does-the-solution-meet-the-goal" id="user-content-you-have-been-informed-by-your-superiors-of-the-company-has-intentions-to-automate-server-deployment-to-azure-there-is-however-some-concern-that-administrative-credentials-could-be-uncovered-during-this-process-you-are-required-to-make-sure-that-during-the-deployment-the-administrative-credentials-are-encrypted-using-a-suitable-azure-solution-solution-you-recommend-the-use-of-azure-multi-factor-authentication-mfa-does-the-solution-meet-the-goal"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>You have been informed by your superiors of the company has intentions to automate server deployment to Azure. <h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#your-company-has-active-directory-forest-includes-thousands-of-user-accounts-you-have-been-informed-that-all-network-resources-will-be-migrated-to-azure-thereafter-the-on-premises-data-center-will-be-retired-you-are-required-to-employ-a-strategy-that-reduces-the-effect-on-users-once-the-planned-migration-has-been-completed-solution-you-plan-to-enforce-password-change-does-the-solution-meet-the-goal" id="user-content-your-company-has-active-directory-forest-includes-thousands-of-user-accounts-you-have-been-informed-that-all-network-resources-will-be-migrated-to-azure-thereafter-the-on-premises-data-center-will-be-retired-you-are-required-to-employ-a-strategy-that-reduces-the-effect-on-users-once-the-planned-migration-has-been-completed-solution-you-plan-to-enforce-password-change-does-the-solution-meet-the-goal"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Your company has Active Directory forest includes thousands of user accounts. You are required to employ a strategy that reduces the effect on users, once the planned migration has been completed. Solution: You plan to enforce password change. Does the solution meet the goal?</h3>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#your-developers-have-created-a-portal-web-app-for-users-in-the-miami-branch-office-the-web-app-will-be-publicly-accessible-and-used-by-the-miami-users-to-retrieve-customer-and-product-information-the-web-app-is-currently-running-in-an-on-premises-test-environment-you-plan-to-host-the-web-app-on-azure-you-need-to-determine-which-azure-web-tier-plan-to-host-the-web-app-the-web-tier-plan-must-meet-the-following-requirements-the-website-will-use-the-miamiweylandcom-url-the-website-will-be-deployed-to-two-instances-ssl-support-must-be-included-the-website-requires-12-gb-of-storage-costs-must-be-minimized-which-web-tier-plan-should-you-use" aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Your developers have created a portal web app for users in the Miami branch office. The web app will be publicly accessible and used by the Miami users to retrieve customer and product information. The web app is currently running in an on-premises test environment. You plan to host the web app on Azure. You need to determine which Azure web tier plan to host the web app. The web tier plan must meet the following requirements: The website will use the miami.weyland.com URL. The website will be deployed to two instances. SSL support must be included. The website requires 12 GB of storage. Costs must be minimized. Which web tier plan should you use?</h3>
<ul class="contains-task-list">
<li class="task-list-item"><input checked="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Standard.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Basic.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Free.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Shared.</li>
</ul>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#your-company-has-datacenters-in-los-angeles-and-new-york-the-company-has-a-microsoft-azure-subscription-you-are-configuring-the-two-datacenters-as-geo-clustered-sites-for-site-resiliency-you-need-to-recommend-an-azure-storage-redundancy-option-you-have-the-following-data-storage-requirements-data-must-be-stored-on-multiple-nodes-data-must-be-stored-on-nodes-in-separate-geographic-locations-data-can-be-read-from-the-secondary-location-as-well-as-from-the-primary-location-which-of-the-following-azure-stored-redundancy-options-should-you-recommend" id="user-content-your-company-has-datacenters-in-los-angeles-and-new-york-the-company-has-a-microsoft-azure-subscription-you-are-configuring-the-two-datacenters-as-geo-clustered-sites-for-site-resiliency-you-need-to-recommend-an-azure-storage-redundancy-option-you-have-the-following-data-storage-requirements-data-must-be-stored-on-multiple-nodes-data-must-be-stored-on-nodes-in-separate-geographic-locations-data-can-be-read-from-the-secondary-location-as-well-as-from-the-primary-location-which-of-the-following-azure-stored-redundancy-options-should-you-recommend"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Your company has datacenters in Los Angeles and New York. You have the following data storage requirements: Data must be stored on multiple nodes. Data must be stored on nodes in separate geographic locations. Data can be read from the secondary location as well as from the primary location Which of the following Azure stored redundancy options should you recommend?</h3>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#an-azure-subscription-can-be-associated-to-multiple-azure-active-directory-azure-ad-tenants" id="user-content-an-azure-subscription-can-be-associated-to-multiple-azure-active-directory-azure-ad-tenants"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>An Azure subscription can be associated to multiple Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenants.</h3>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#data-transfers-between-azure-services-located-in-different-azure-regions-are-always-free" id="user-content-data-transfers-between-azure-services-located-in-different-azure-regions-are-always-free"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Data transfers between Azure services located in different Azure regions are always free.</h3>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#you-have-an-application-that-is-comprised-of-an-azure-web-app-that-has-a-service-level-agreement-sla-of-9995-percent-and-an-azure-sql-database-that-has-an-sla-of-9999-percent-the-composite-sla-for-the-application-is-" id="user-content-you-have-an-application-that-is-comprised-of-an-azure-web-app-that-has-a-service-level-agreement-sla-of-9995-percent-and-an-azure-sql-database-that-has-an-sla-of-9999-percent-the-composite-sla-for-the-application-is-"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>You have an application that is comprised of an Azure web app that has a Service Level Agreement (SLA) of 99.95 percent and an Azure SQL database that has an SLA of 99.99 percent. The composite SLA for the application is [...].</h3>
<ul class="contains-task-list">
<li class="task-list-item"><input checked="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The product of both SLAS, which equals 99.94 percent.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The lowest SLA associated to the application, which is 99.95 percent.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The highest SLA associated to the application, which is 99.99 percent.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The difference between the two SLAS, which is 0.05 percent.</li>
</ul>

<ul class="contains-task-list">
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Microsoft provides mainstream support for a service for five years.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input checked="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> Microsoft provides a minimum of 12 months notice before ending support for a service.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> After a service is made generally available, Microsoft provides support for the service for a minimum of four years.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> When a service is retired, you can purchase extended support for the service for up to five years.</li>
</ul>

<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#your-company-plans-to-migrate-all-its-data-and-resources-to-azure-the-company-migration-plan-states-that-only-platform-as-a-service-paas-solutions-must-be-used-in-azure-you-need-to-deploy-an-azure-environment-that-supports-the-planned-migration-solution-you-create-an-azure-app-service-and-azure-storage-accounts-does-this-meet-the-goal" id="user-content-your-company-plans-to-migrate-all-its-data-and-resources-to-azure-the-company-migration-plan-states-that-only-platform-as-a-service-paas-solutions-must-be-used-in-azure-you-need-to-deploy-an-azure-environment-that-supports-the-planned-migration-solution-you-create-an-azure-app-service-and-azure-storage-accounts-does-this-meet-the-goal"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>Your company plans to migrate all its data and resources to Azure. <h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#authorization-is-the-process-of-verifying-a-user-credentials" id="user-content-authorization-is-the-process-of-verifying-a-user-credentials"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>[Authorization] is the process of verifying a user credentials.</h3>

</ul>
<p dir="auto"><em><a href="#table-of-contents"><g-emoji alias="arrow_up" class="g-emoji" fallback-src="https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/2b06.png">⬆</g-emoji> Back to Top</a></em></p>
<h3 dir="auto" tabindex="-1"><a aria-hidden="true" class="anchor" href="#you-plan-to-migrate-several-servers-from-an-on-premises-network-to-azure-you-need-to-identify-the-primary-benefit-of-using-a-public-cloud-service-for-the-servers-what-should-you-identify" id="user-content-you-plan-to-migrate-several-servers-from-an-on-premises-network-to-azure-you-need-to-identify-the-primary-benefit-of-using-a-public-cloud-service-for-the-servers-what-should-you-identify"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a>You plan to migrate several servers from an on-premises network to Azure. You need to identify the primary benefit of using a public cloud service for the servers. What should you identify?</h3>
<ul class="contains-task-list">
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The public cloud is owned by the public, NOT a private corporation.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> All public cloud resources can be freely accessed by every member of the public.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The public cloud is a crowd-sourcing solution that provides corporations with the ability to enhance the cloud.</li>
<li class="task-list-item"><input checked="" class="task-list-item-checkbox" disabled="" id="" type="checkbox"/> The public cloud is a shared entity whereby multiple corporations each use a portion of the resources in the cloud.</li>
</ul>
<p dir="auto"><em><a href="#table-of-contents"><g-emoji alias="arrow_up" class="g-emoji" fallback-src="https://github.githubassets.com/images/icons/emoji/unicode/2b06.png">⬆</g-emoji> Back to Top</a></em></p>
</article>
</div>
</div>
</readme-toc>
</div>

<div class="BorderGrid BorderGrid--spacious" data-pjax="">
